snippet.title: BMW Slashes M140i Price As Part Of 1 Series Range Revision
snippet.content:
has adjusted the price and specifications of its entry-level range, resulting in a cheaper price for the flagship M140i, but price rises for most other variants. The range opens with the 118i, which goes up in price by $2000 and now starts from $39,990 plus on-road costs. The 118i is powered by a turbocharged 1.5-litre three-cylinder petrol engine producing 100kW and 220Nm, matched to an eight-speed automatic transmission. Standard equipment extends to 16-inch alloy wheels, LED headlights, DAB+ digital radio, reversing camera, sports steering wheel, and BMW's latest iDrive 6 infotainment system plus Sport Line trim including cloth upholstered front sports seats. The BMW 118d matches the 118i's standard features list but is instead powered by a 2.0-litre four-cylinder turbo diesel engine producing 110kW and 320Nm. Pricing for the 118d also goes up by $2000 for a price of $43,990 plus on-road costs The next step up, the BMW 120i suffers a larger price hike, up by $3000 to start at $45,990 for the 135kW/270Nm 2.0-litre four-cylinder turbocharged petrol-powered model. The 120i comes loaded with BMW's Urban Line trim, and adds standard features like 17-inch light alloy wheels, LED fog lights, front and rear parking sensors, Dakota leather upholstery, a self-dimming rear vision mirror, and an interior lighting package.
BMW M140i
Next in line is the 125i which BMW has held steady price-wise at $49,990. Moving up the 125i also brings a more sporting feel thanks to 18-inch light-alloy wheels, an M Sport pack with M suspension and brakes, anti-dazzle exterior mirrors and high gloss Shadow Line exterior trim. On the inside the 125i scores an M leather steering wheel, cloth and Alcantara upholstery, an 8.8-inch touchscreen and a dark grey roofliner. A more powerful version of the 2.0-litre turbocharged petrol four-cylinder engine from the 120i brings outputs up to 165kW and 310Nm. For $59,990 the is the sole model to come down in price, and on top of the features of the 125i also includes adaptive suspension, Harman Kardon premium audio, black 18-inch light-alloy wheels, Dakota leather upholstery, electric seat adjustment, and adaptive LED headlights with auto high beam. As the sole six-cylinder model in the 1 Series range the M140i brings a serious step-up in performance with 250kW and 500Nm from its 3.0-litre turbocharged engine and a no-cost choice of eight-speed automatic or six-speed manual transmission.
